title: Hope people realize that LeBlanc is only doing this cancerous Lich Bane+Gun Blade build because...
body: You completely gutted our W and RW, and now we have 0 burst potential so we need the extra damage instead of having to wait 1.5 seconds to assassinate someone when people like {{champion:107}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:105}} go around the map instakilling people.

replies.body: Just spam {{champion:103}} she'll never be nerfed and probably is cancerous with that same build

This isn't true. She was nerfed indirectly when they increased the movement speed of all champions.

As someone who has been playing since 2011, I have seen ahri go through periods where people would report you for playing a bad champ (ahri).

There's a small (maybe not really small but still) difference between "she WILL never be nerfed" and "she WAS nerfed".

Ahri is the Janna of midlane. High pick rate, high win rate for almost 2 years now, and never nerfed as much as other midlaners. Yet she's considered somehow "balanced" and never touched.

I'm fine with Ahri being a common pick though, just because she doesn't feel shit to play against. Still 10x better than Fizz or Ekko.

Last Ahri "nerf" was that charm fix that doesn't interrupt dashes anymore. 

Last "real" nerf was in 5.16, when they slightly reduced the healing from her passive.

I mean, that's how Ahri has been nerfed. I can't even call those "nerfs" compared to how LB's kit was gutted (after a stupid rework).

Charm nerf was pretty impactful tho.

Edit: I am legitimately curious as to why I got downvoted for my comments in this thread. Nothing I said was wrong.
Against like 3 mid lane matchups.

It ain't just about the laning match ups. It denied offensive dashes like Diana, LeBlanc, Nidalee, Kha'zix, Rengar, etc. Prevented defensive ones like Tristana, Lucian, etc.

Imagine how much people would moan about how safe she'd be if she still stopped dashes like they moan now.

Then good riddance, I day. If fear and taunt don't stop dashes, charm should not either.

Also, using the word moan when describing anything Ahri-related is quite fitting and hilarious.

As a Diana deuter-main Ahri's Charm was the least of my worries playing against her.
Especially with the Lunar Rush cooldown refund change like 2 seasons ago.

I mean, I'd basically need to ult into an incoming Charm for it to have any effect. Otherwise I'd end up grabbing Ahri's butt before she's able to finish the casting animation.

If the Ahri could predict well, it'd neuter Diana's all-in by stopping her first dash and denying the second. Unless that specified refund change made it so that even if interrupted she still gets the reset. Still neutered her all-ins though.

It definitely gave an out to being hit by Diana's Q though, if you were good enough.
Merely casting Lunar Rush on a target affected by Moonlight refunds the cooldown.

As a player who loved to play against _(As a Syndra main LB was always one of the easiest matchups)_ the pre-rework LeBlanc _(the one from Season 3 too)_ I was sceptic, but when I played LeBlanc after the Assassin Update I simply felt sad for LB players.

That delay is very forced and not fun for either the player nor the enemy.

Basically it means that the current version of LeBlanc will end up in one of 3 states balance-wise:

1. She will have high enough non-passive damage to not completely suck if she can't proc the passive, but making it overbearing once she does, or
2. The passive will deal shit damage so she can be balanced around abilities which invalidates her part in the Assassin Update entirely, or
3. Her passive will deal high damage, but her abilities will be piss poor weak to compensate that added power.
